relation: There are several places near campus to hang out and have a good time. Cruise down Central and your bound to run into something you might enjoy.
the SUB has good spots to eat and study but I think there needs to be a better diversity of the dining offered on campus.
I have never lived in the dorms on campus so I have no comment about them.
Most of the professors I have encountered have high expectations from their students and make the classes challenging but are always available to help when needed.

Take advantage of all the resources offered. Classes that may be hard for you can become less difficult if you use all the resources available. I take advantage of SI leaders and CAPS tutors whenever they are available for the classes I am taking.
So far my experiences here have been pleasant. I would give UNM an A+
pageTitle: University of New Mexico (UNM) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {621434=In December around Christmas, students participate in the Hanging of the Greens. As students walk around the campus caroling, luminarias (traditional New Mexican Christmas lights) are lit throughout the entire campus along with decorations. Another tradition we have is the burning of the Aggie; our rival school's (NMSU) mascot. During Red Rally, the students build a giant Aggie and at the end of Red Rally week, we burn the Aggie down!, 363283=Casas del Rio, Redondo, and Hokona Hall, I would say are without a doubt the best dorms on campus. Also, Casas del Rio are new for the fall 2012 semester., 578210=Albuquerque is home, but I've heard if you are from out of state it is hard to adjust. I love it here, and can't wait to graduate in May of next year!, 831214=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 232871=Get good grades. Ask your parents to get their federal taxes done as early after Jan. 1st as possible (if you're a dependent) or get your taxes done asap after Jan. 1st (if you're independent). Complete and submit the FAFSA as soon after Jan. 1st also (definitely before March 1st, which is UNM's priority deadline to be considered for institutional scholarships) and apply to AS MANY scholarships as you can in the first quarter of the year., 88278=Every Fall we have Red Rally, which is the beginning of Homecoming Week. For Red Rally, we burn a giant NM State Aggie (our rival school). On May 4th, we have May the Fourth Be With You, which is big Star Wars festival on campus. We also have several international and culture festivals on campus, which provide great entertainment on your walk between classes.}

textAfterTable: Juan from Tijeras, NM 01/06/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 11 out of 11 people found this review useful. 2 of 198 Categories Comments Great for these types of students UNM is perfect for almost all students. UNM offers a large variety of degress that suit just about everyones interests. Tips for prospective students If you are at all interested in UNM, I urge you to take a campus tour, and apply. I also urge you to find and apply for any scholarship you can find. Bang for the buck UNM has very competitive tuition rates for both in state and out of state students. I am from New Mexico and initially wanted to go out of state. I applied for several schools in Oregon and was accepted to all of them with scholarships. I soon realized that because of New Mexico's lottery scholarship, UNM was by far the best bang for my buck. UNM also led me through the loan application for the small amount that I do need. UNM is not
